channel.title: NLP on Jacques Serizay
channel.description: Recent content in NLP on Jacques Serizay

item.title: Machine Learning and Natural Langage Processing
item.description: Inspired from https://machinelearningmastery.com/how-to-develop-a-word-level-neural-language-model-in-keras/ Clean-up data and select Results chapters cat txt/collated_books.txt | \ tr '\n' ' ' | \ sed "s,', ,g" | \ sed "s,_,,g" | \ sed 's,[ ]\+, ,g' | \ sed "s,^ ,,g" > txt/collated_books_stripped.txt Create a new conda env. conda create -n keras python=3.6 tensorflow keras nltk conda activate keras Start python import numpy as np import tensorflow as tf tf.config.threading.set_inter_op_parallelism_threads(1) tf.config.threading.set_intra_op_parallelism_threads(1) import keras from pickle import dump from keras import backend as K from keras.

item.title: Text mining and sentiment analysis in R
item.description: Pre-processing LOTR text in R Complete LOTR text can be downloaded from Kaggle: https://www.kaggle.com/ashishsinhaiitr/lord-of-the-rings-text. I edited the text very quickly, by simply removing the foreword and name of each of the 3 tomes. I also added the “book” II to VI (there was only an entry for “Book I”, the others were missing). Finally, I collated the three tomes together. library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.
